dependencies.description:
AMD Optimized BLIS. BLIS is a portable software framework for
instantiating high-performance BLAS-like dense linear algebra libraries.
The framework was designed to isolate essential kernels of computation
that, when optimized, immediately enable optimized implementations of
most of its commonly used and computationally intensive operations.
LICENSING INFORMATION: By downloading, installing and using this
software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the AMD AOCL-BLIS
license agreement. You may obtain a copy of this license agreement from
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/dense/eula/blas-4-2-eula.html
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/dense/eula/blas-eula.html
dependencies.name: amdblis

dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.
dependencies.name: cmake

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description: Google test framework for C++. Also called gtest.
dependencies.name: googletest

dependencies.description:
HIP is a C++ Runtime API and Kernel Language that allows developers to
create portable applications for AMD and NVIDIA GPUs from single source
code.
dependencies.name: hip

dependencies.description:
Toolkit for the construction of highly optimized compilers, optimizers,
and run-time environments.
dependencies.name: llvm-amdgpu

dependencies.description: A small, fast binary interchange format convertible to/from JSON
dependencies.name: msgpack-c

dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.
dependencies.name: ninja

dependencies.description: Perl implementation of the which utility as an API
dependencies.name: perl-file-which

dependencies.description:
Command line and full screen utilities for browsing procfs, a "pseudo"
file system dynamically generated by the kernel to provide information
about the status of entries in its process table.
dependencies.name: procps

dependencies.description: Lightweight pipelining with Python functions.
dependencies.name: py-joblib

dependencies.description: MessagePack (de)serializer.
dependencies.name: py-msgpack

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.
dependencies.name: py-pyyaml

dependencies.description: virtualenv is a tool to create isolated Python environments.
dependencies.name: py-virtualenv

dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.
dependencies.name: py-wheel

dependencies.description: The Python programming language.
dependencies.name: python

dependencies.description:
rocm-cmake provides CMake modules for common build tasks in the ROCm
software stack
dependencies.name: rocm-cmake

dependencies.description: OpenMP support for ROCm LLVM.
dependencies.name: rocm-openmp-extras

dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute (ROCm) Runtime rocminfo tool
dependencies.name: rocminfo

dependent_to.description:
C++ API for the Basic Linear Algebra Subroutines. Developed by the
Innovative Computing Laboratory at the University of Tennessee,
Knoxville.
dependent_to.name: blaspp

dependent_to.description: Distributed Communication-Optimal Matrix-Matrix Multiplication Library
dependent_to.name: cosma

dependent_to.description: DLA-Future library: Distributed Linear Algebra with Future
dependent_to.name: dla-future

dependent_to.description: Eigenvalue solvers for Petaflop-Applications (ELPA)
dependent_to.name: elpa

dependent_to.description: Highly Efficient FFT for Exascale
dependent_to.name: heffte

dependent_to.description: hipBLAS is a BLAS marshalling library, with multiple supported backends
dependent_to.name: hipblas

dependent_to.description:
hipSOLVER is a LAPACK marshalling library, with multiple supported
backends. It sits between the application and a 'worker' LAPACK library,
marshalling inputs into the backend library and marshalling results back
to the application. hipSOLVER exports an interface that does not require
the client to change, regardless of the chosen backend. Currently,
hipSOLVER supports rocSOLVER and cuSOLVER as backends.
dependent_to.name: hipsolver

dependent_to.description:
Kokkos Kernels provides math kernels, often BLAS or LAPACK for small
matrices, that can be used in larger Kokkos parallel routines
dependent_to.name: kokkos-kernels

dependent_to.description:
LAPACK++: C++ API for the LAPACK Linear Algebra Package. Developed by
the Innovative Computing Laboratory at the University of Tennessee,
Knoxville.
dependent_to.name: lapackpp

dependent_to.description: AMD's graph optimization engine.
dependent_to.name: migraphx

dependent_to.description: AMD's library for high performance machine learning primitives.
dependent_to.name: miopen-hip

dependent_to.description: AMD's library for high performance machine learning primitives.
dependent_to.name: miopen-opencl

dependent_to.description: Nonlinear CG methods for wave-function optimization in DFT.
dependent_to.name: nlcglib

dependent_to.description:
PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable
(parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial
differential equations.
dependent_to.name: petsc

dependent_to.description: C++ runtime system for parallellism and concurrency.
dependent_to.name: pika

dependent_to.description:
PyFR is an open-source Python based framework for solving advection-
diffusion type problems on streaming architectures using the Flux
Reconstruction approach of Huynh.
dependent_to.name: py-pyfr

dependent_to.description: TensorFlow is an open source machine learning framework for everyone.
dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow

dependent_to.description:
Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU
acceleration.
dependent_to.name: py-torch

dependent_to.description: A Redis module for serving tensors and executing deep learning graphs
dependent_to.name: redis-ai

dependent_to.description:
ReSolve is a library of GPU-resident sparse linear solvers. It contains
iterative and direct solvers designed to run on NVIDIA and AMD GPUs, as
well as CPU devices.
dependent_to.name: resolve

dependent_to.description:
rocALUTION is a sparse linear algebra library with focus on exploring
fine-grained parallelism on top of AMD's Radeon Open eCosystem Platform
ROCm runtime and toolchains, targeting modern CPU and GPU platforms.
Based on C++ and HIP, it provides a portable, generic and flexible
design that allows seamless integration with other scientific software
packages.
dependent_to.name: rocalution

dependent_to.description:
The ROCm Validation Suite (RVS) is a system administrators and cluster
manager's tool for detecting and troubleshooting common problems
affecting AMD GPU(s) running in a high-performance computing
environment, enabled using the ROCm software stack on a compatible
platform.
dependent_to.name: rocm-validation-suite

dependent_to.description:
rocSOLVER is a work-in-progress implementation of a subset of LAPACK
functionality on the ROCm platform.
dependent_to.name: rocsolver

dependent_to.description:
AMD's C++ library for accelerating mixed precision matrix multiplication
and accumulation (MFMA) operations leveraging specialized GPU matrix
cores. rocWMMA provides a C++ API to facilitate breaking down matrix
multiply-accumulate problems into fragments and using them in block-wise
operations that are distributed in parallel across GPU wavefronts. The
API is a header library of GPU device code meaning that matrix core
acceleration may be compiled directly into your kernel device code. This
can benefit from compiler optimization in the generation of kernel
assembly, and does not incur additional overhead costs of linking to
external runtime libraries or having to launch separate kernels.
dependent_to.name: rocwmma

dependent_to.description: Domain specific library for electronic structure calculations
dependent_to.name: sirius

dependent_to.description:
The Software for Linear Algebra Targeting Exascale (SLATE) project is to
provide fundamental dense linear algebra capabilities to the US
Department of Energy and to the high-performance computing (HPC)
community at large. To this end, SLATE will provide basic dense matrix
operations (e.g., matrix multiplication, rank-k update, triangular
solve), linear systems solvers, least square solvers, singular value and
eigenvalue solvers.
dependent_to.name: slate

dependent_to.description:
Specialized Parallel Linear Algebra, providing distributed GEMM
functionality for specific matrix distributions with optional GPU
acceleration.
dependent_to.name: spla

dependent_to.description:
The Toolkit for Adaptive Stochastic Modeling and Non-Intrusive
ApproximatioN is a robust library for high dimensional integration and
interpolation as well as parameter calibration.
dependent_to.name: tasmanian

dependent_to.description:
Matrix multiplication on GPUs for matrices stored on a CPU. Similar to
cublasXt, but ported to both NVIDIA and AMD GPUs.
dependent_to.name: tiled-mm

variants.description: Build with address-sanitizer enabled or disabled
variants.name: asan

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system

variants.description: the build system generator to use
variants.name: generator
